definition: To cause harm or damage to something or someone, often resulting in their deterioration, spoilage, or corruption. It is commonly used to describe the process of food or perishable items going bad, as well as the negative impact on relationships, plans, or situations.

examples.german: Das Essen wird verderben, wenn du es nicht in den Kühlschrank stellst.
examples.english: The food will spoil if you don't put it in the fridge.

examples.german: Die schlechte Nachricht hat seine Stimmung verderben.
examples.english: The bad news spoiled his mood.

examples.german: Der Regen wird unsere Pläne verderben.
examples.english: The rain will spoil our plans.

examples.german: Die Korruption hat das Land verderbt.
Die Milch ist verderben und kann nicht mehr getrunken werden.
examples.english: The milk has gone bad and cannot be consumed anymore.
